Welcome to How To Cook That, I'm Ann ReardonÂ 
and it's time for another relaxing episode ofÂ Â

miniature cooking ğŸ˜ Today I thought we'd make aÂ 
mini box of chocolates, so to start with we areÂ Â

of course going to need some chocolate. So let'sÂ 
unwrap that block and then break it up into littleÂ Â

pieces. I don't actually think this whole blockÂ 
will fit into such a small bowl so i'll just getÂ Â

as much in as i can that will do and now weÂ 
want to microwave that. Now normally i'd sayÂ Â

30 seconds, stir, 30 seconds stir, but this isÂ 
such a tiny amount that it won't take that long.Â Â

Then give that a stir to make sure that it isÂ 
all melted then add that melted chocolate ontoÂ Â

the mold. Now these chocolates are going to be soÂ 
tiny that even one air bubble is going to create aÂ Â

major problem with their shape so once i've spreadÂ 
it on as well as i can i'm going to drop it a fewÂ Â

times really hoping to get any air bubblesÂ 
out from inside the molds and up to the top.Â Â

Then just use an offset spatula to level off theÂ 
tops, now if you're a long time subscriber thenÂ Â

you'll know that i have a whole series of videosÂ 
on how to make chocolate truffles with heaps ofÂ Â

different fillings for them but i'm not going toÂ 
fill these with anything because they're just tooÂ Â

tiny and while I wait for those to set thoughÂ 
I might just make something else out of thisÂ Â

leftover chocolate. Let's start by fillingÂ 
up a pot with water just turn on that tapÂ Â

and turn it off and then pop that pan onto theÂ 
stove top. Put the chocolate in a bowl on theÂ Â

top of the pan and then add some butter to thatÂ 
and then give it a stir you want to keep stirringÂ Â

until all the butter and chocolate is meltedÂ 
you could of course do this in the microwaveÂ Â

if you prefer ... that's looking good. NowÂ 
you just want to sift in the flour siftingÂ Â

the flour just gets rid of the lumps and alsoÂ 
helps aerate it adds a bit of air to the mixtureÂ Â

and then add in some sugar. Grab your cocoa powderÂ 
put that into the mix and then whisk that togetherÂ Â

to make sure it's all mixed in then we want to addÂ 
the eggs ğŸ¥š and I nearly forgot the baking powderÂ Â

it won't rise without that. Mix it all togetherÂ 
and then tip that mixture into a lined cake tinÂ Â

and then put that into the oven to bake. WhileÂ 
that's baking let's check on the chocolates ...Â Â

I don't even know if i'm going to beÂ 
able to get these out of the mold,Â Â

I've never attempted to make chocolateÂ 
that's this tiny before ... here we goÂ Â

oh they're coming out! This one here has a prettyÂ 
bad air bubble in it and so does that one but mostÂ Â

of the others look like they turned out okay soÂ 
now to decorate them. Let's put a tiny stripe ofÂ Â

white chocolate across the top of the squareÂ 
ones and we'll give that a second stripe justÂ Â

going across and some dark chocolate onto some ofÂ 
the others. Because these are so tiny it's reallyÂ Â

hard to pipe onto them without just piping a blobÂ 
of chocolate that's as big as the chocolate itselfÂ Â

and then i'm going to have to use a knifeÂ 
to cut the chocolate stripes in between theÂ Â

pieces because it's too light just to fall downÂ 
the sides like it normally would at full size.Â Â

Now that they're set let's put them into a box. IfÂ 
you want to make your own tiny box of chocolatesÂ Â

i'll put the template for this box on theÂ 
howtocookthat.net website for you but be warnedÂ Â

it's really fiddly to fold it is suchÂ 
a mini box and then putting chocolatesÂ Â

into it is also very tricky but they doÂ 
look oh so cute when they're all done!Â Â

Oh let's not forget about our cake in theÂ 
oven let's get that out and turn off the
heat.Â

Things cool down fairly quickly when they're thisÂ 
small so we can tip it out onto the cooling rack.Â Â

Once it's completely cold pop the cake onto aÂ 
plate and sprinkle it with some icing sugar.Â Â

Then you just want to cut a slice and serve it up.Â 
Now some people have said to me because the wholeÂ Â

kitchen is miniature they sometimes forget justÂ 
how small all of this is so for size comparisonÂ Â

here is the box of chocolates next to an ordinaryÂ 
fork ... it's really small. This chocolate cakeÂ Â

is very moist and very chocolatey and the recipeÂ 
for it is of course in my Crazy Sweet CreationsÂ Â

cookbook and I'll link you to that below andÂ 
I'll also link you to the playlist of all theÂ Â

normal size chocolate truffles if you want to makeÂ 
a normal box of chocolates rather than a mini one.Â Â

I'll leave you with a compilation of some of myÂ 
other mini videos that i've made in the past soÂ Â

you can enjoy them all in the one place makeÂ 
it a great week and i'll see you on Friday.

With thanks to my patrons for all your support.Â 
In a world where people love to be discouragingÂ Â

you guys are a breath of fresh air! Make itÂ 
a great week and i'll see you on Friday ğŸ˜€
